llama2-70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 2nd):

* Fly from Boston to Wilmington, North Carolina (Flight Number F3635146, Departure Time 08:53, Arrival Time 09:55, Duration 1 hour 2 minutes, Distance 185 miles)
* Take a taxi from Wilmington Airport to your accommodation (cost $185)
* Check-in at a hotel in Wilmington that provides entire rooms and can accommodate visitors (cost $67 per night)
* Spend the rest of the day exploring Wilmington's attractions, such as the Cape Fear Riverwalk, Airlie Gardens, and the North Carolina Aquarium

Day 2 (March 3rd):

* Take a taxi from your hotel to the Wilmington train station (cost $16)
* Board the train to Charlotte, North Carolina (Flight Number F3662314, Departure Time 13:21, Arrival Time 15:18, Duration 1 hour 57 minutes, Distance 324 miles)
* Take a taxi from the Charlotte train station to your accommodation (cost $324)
* Check-in at a hotel in Charlotte that provides entire rooms and can accommodate visitors (cost $65 per night)
* Spend the rest of the day exploring Charlotte's attractions, such as the NASCAR Hall of Fame, Discovery Place Science, and the Mint Museum

Day 3 (March 4th):

* Spend the day visiting additional attractions in Charlotte, such as the Carolinas Aviation Museum, the Billy Graham Library, and Freedom Park

Day 4 (March 5th):

* Take a taxi from your hotel to the Charlotte airport (cost $23)
* Fly back to Boston (Flight Number F3711164, Departure Time 11:33, Arrival Time 13:36, Duration 2 hours 3 minutes, Distance 728 miles)
* Take a taxi from the Boston airport to your final destination (cost $25)

Total Cost for 4 people: $8,800

Note: The itinerary and costs are based on the assumptions provided and may vary depending on individual preferences and actual availability. It is recommended to double-check with the airlines, hotels, and transportation services for the most up-to-date information and prices.
